result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
4:04 PM Defendant LADERRIOUS Q JONES in court.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Brian William Severson in court for LADERRIOUS Q JONES. Atty Severson states the defendant is requesting the preliminary hearing. Statement by DA Laspisa - has one witness. 

Scott Cody sworn, direct by DA Laspisa, is employed as a Detective for the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department. Was employed on the date in question. Venue established. Testimony given. Identified the defendant present in court. Cross exam by Atty Severson. Objection by DA Lasisa. Sustained. Atty Severson continues with cross examination. Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony has been committed and that the felony probably was committed by the defendant and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files an information with the court, same as the criminal complaint. Attorney Severson waives any reading. Atty Severson enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant. Court will set for Return Date on June 20, 2022 at 10:30 AM.

Court adjourned at 4:14 PM
Return date scheduled for June 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Return date on June 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 23, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
**PROCESSING COMPLETE**
Preliminary hearing on March 8, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

No Contact with the victim or anyone else listed in the criminal complaint. Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

No Contact with the victim or anyone else listed in the criminal complaint. Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

ADDRESS INFO for LADERRIOUS Q JONES
Current: 3022 N 53rd St, Milwaukee, WI 53210 United States  (Effective: 02-01-2022)
Prior: 3024 N 53Rd St, Milwaukee, WI 53210

9:40 AM Defendant LADERRIOUS Q JONES appeared in court, Attorney Brian William Severson appeared in court for LADERRIOUS Q JONES, Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Severson confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. DA Laspisa makes bond recommendation. Atty Severson makes bond recommendation. Court sets bond at $500 signature bond and conditions of: No Contact with victim or anyone listed in the criminal complaint. Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department. 30 days to complete processing.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant waives the time limits and requests a preliminary hearing. Court will set for Prelim March 08, 2022 at 4:00 PM.

Court adjourned at 9:44 AM.
Initial appearance on February 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.
